name: Handsthematics
description:
Handsthematics is an educational game prototype produced during the jam #DevIdeaWeek3.

This game can be played alone or with another player locally. Your goal is to have the best score in 1 minute. To do that, you have to open / close fingers in order to have the right calculation. Be careful, the sign and result change everytime.

Have fun.

PS: Tell me what you think and put your best score in the comment 😉.

How to play

Use R to restart the game when you have finished.

Recommended to use a QWERTY keyboard layout.

  • Left Hand
    • Thumb -> C
    • Index Finger -> R
    • Middle Finger -> E
    • Ring Finger -> W
    • Little Finger-> Q
  • Right Hand
    • Thumb -> N
    • Index Finger -> U
    • Middle Finger -> I
    • Ring Finger -> O
    • Little Finger -> P

⚠️ The game can work badly because of  keyboard ghosting.

Credits

Developped by Carreira Rémi using Unity3D.

Hands have been made by Samet.

SFX have been made by SyseQ.
